originalText.text: Packed in the evening as always.  Busy with trains and people.  Try to avoid this station in evening.  Smell is weird and rats are everywhere.

text.text: Packed in the evening as always.  Busy with trains and people.  Try to avoid this station in evening.  Smell is weird and rats are everywhere.

originalText.text: so confuse even I have been in NYC over 12 years. If you want to connect between B D F M line and 6, you need to walk down to the bottom then going up again to be able to go to the 6 line. No clear sign to tell you where to go. You need to fix it out from your experience. Luckily, I guess right so at the end, I was able to go to the direction I wanted to go but I just feel sorry for lots of tourist or another people who still lost in this labyrinth subway. I couldn't help them at that time because I also lost too, LOL.

originalText.text: Would have given it 5 stars but the uptown 6 train directions were a little confusing. Would have helped if they had signs in both directions that said the uptown 6 train were only accessable at the end of only one platform.

text.text: Would have given it 5 stars but the uptown 6 train directions were a little confusing. Would have helped if they had signs in both directions that said the uptown 6 train were only accessable at the end of only one platform.

originalText.text:
Go and see the DAvid Bowie exhibition.

Broadway–Lafayette Street/Bleecker Street is a New York City Subway station complex in the NoHo district of Manhattan on the IRT Lexington Avenue Line and the IND Sixth Avenue Line. It is served by the:

6, D, and F trains at all times
B and M trains on weekdays
 train during rush hours in the peak direction
4 train during late nights

The complex comprises two stations, Bleecker Street (IRT) and Broadway–Lafayette Street (IND). The transfer between the downtown IRT platform and the IND platform has been within fare control since May 19, 1957, and the corresponding free transfer from the uptown IRT platform to the rest of the station opened on September 25, 2012.

Artwork: Signal (Mel Chin)

Location: Broadway-Lafayette · Installed: 1998

Glass, steel, ceraminc, and lighting. Stainless steel and glass sculptures on the mezzanine columns; plus ceramic tiles on the station's walls.

originalText.text: It was a good station overall. I had no issues, except that there were a lot of stairs. Overall, the station is not bad, though.
